description: head of man viewed from mouth up, with mustache, sunglasses, dark cap; man's face is red; sunglasses with one blue lens and one orange lens; dark green background; on white paper; overmat; black wood frame with bark-like texture; UV glazing; wire attached
inscription: lower L margin; graphite: Self Portrait - Lots and Lots of Love
markings: printed paper label verso frame at C: PERLTONE PRINT / This limited edition is an electronic color / impression. Some areas have been hand / colored. Keep out of bright light.
signed: lower R margin, graphite: A/P Jack Perlmutter
text: Produced in the 1980s, Jack Perlmutter's unconventional self-portrait is characteristic of the artist's penchant for blending elements of naturalistic realism and abstraction. Likely based on a photograph, Perlmutter depicts himself wearing a black Greek fisherman's cap and sunglasses. To heighten the work's visual punch, he cropped the original image to emphasize his eyes, mustache, and facial expression, while replacing naturalistic color with dazzling tones of red, orange, and blue. Perlmutter would have been in his sixties when he created this print, and reveals how he wished to be perceived.
title: Self-portrait
